column4: hello everyone,I get this message when i try to play some vido DVD's,: The file contains an unsupported video format. The needed codec is not installed on your system. (file:///media/cdrom0/Main.swf),anyone to help?
i've got VLC,but still can't play the video
it's auto dvd file
auto dvd ?
i can play 'dvdmovie.iso' files here in vlc -  but im not sure if i have that decss stuff installed or not
i can play audio cd's they work fine,but I can't play auto CD's,DVD's
err.. auto ruynning is a feature of the OS. not the cd
at Medibuntu repos
does that mean ,i can't play auto cd's with OS?
your use of the term 'auto' cd is just.. weird..  the OS sees the cd get changed and auto launches/does stuff.. theres no 'auto cd'  its just a music cd. or video dvd
the w32codecs pack is also at mediubuntu repos
I got all codecs relvant to playing cd'dvs's already
you can try playing the file via the command line with vlc or mplayer.  'mplayer whatever.avi' and it may tell you what codecs its trying to use and whats missing.
needs our help and support.. :)
i never use openoffice
ask your questions in the channel if you want answers - not pming me..  Im here then gone for hours at a time
use the package manager tools to install the software mentioned
theres several 'chm' viewers in the package manager listing. gnochm i think is one.
so 'sudo apt-get install gnochm' will install that one
try loading them into openoffice
the openoffice doesn't have something similar to access though,does it?
try   double clicking on it and see if OpenOffice Opens it.
the CHM files now r working thank you very much
